description: From Latin ībex (“chamois”), possibly from Iberian or Aquitanian; akin to Old Spanish bezerro (“bull”) (modern becerro (“yearling”)).

nouns.description: ibex (plural ibex or ibexes or ibices)

entries.meaning: A type of wild mountain goat of the genus Capra, such as the species Capra ibex.
(heraldry) An imaginary creature with serrated horns, somewhat similar to the heraldic antelope.
